column5: oh you have no idea how hard it is to reframe from myself!!!!!!!!!!!!  kinda interesting though ...toothpaste is a alkaline base product and lemon/orange/vinager are acids...
Give it a try.... works great
I still don't understand why you guys don't wear gloves, allergic or not there is no stink on my hands when I'm done cleaning fish, lol.
I don't know Bill.... it's a man thing I guess LOL

For those that clean fish and wonder how to get the smell off your hands.... god knows it takes a few days for the smell to go away.... here's a quick way.....  after rising your hands thoroughly with water, apply a generous amount of tooth paste, rub it in and rinse it off with water and voila..... no more smell Leechman
thanks leech next time i will give it a try
GoJo Baby GoJo!!!   Rob C
I'll have to try that. Thanks for the tip
that sounds beater than my way. i use vinegar and if you have a cut or deep scratch you find out fast Thanks will try that next time
It's a very cheap but effective way to eliminate fish odor... This afternoon had to clean 3 trouts and gave it a good rub and no smell.... simply amazing Leechman
I'm allergic to fish and use surgical gloves anytime I need to fillet a fish...
Or some lemon juice
What's your point???  I'm not allergic to fish and don't weir gloves     Joke / Joke  I hear you Bill but this tip is for the none allergic
Hey Dan... this is better than lemon juice    Try it next time
I will, I hate the smell of bass and musky on my hands after filleting.
:thumbsup_anim:
Thanks for the tip. I used that heavy duty degreacer "Mojo" stuff yesterday and that didnt even take the smell off.
Very funny
Ketchup (Catsup) works good also!
Thanks for the tip.  I am going to give that a try.  I have always used lemon juice.
the orange mechanic soap works wonders too! for me anyway...... I got lots of it layin around so I decided to use it the other day after cleaing my bass and pike.
WD-40
I wish I had to worry about such things.
That put a smile in my aisle  :thumbsup_anim:

Never tried it.... I'm sure it works just as good   I used lemon juice before and it works.... tooth paste leaves a nicer smell on your skin   Yeah that too!!!   That stuff works wonders.... good for fish attractant and smell repellent!!!   I wish I had too Chris.... but the better half does not like fish... period     So this is the solution for me
Real men don't wash their hands after filleting  fish...
You guys are too funny, I wouldn't expect this topic to be so popular and I can't believe the obvious smart   comments haven't been made yet..LOL!!!!!
Oh now.... don't tell me ya use gloves too     Sorry Bill didn't mean to..... but just couldn't resist   What did you expect??     It's tooth paste LOL
Sounds good to me too. No more wiping towels with smelly fish hands.lol
